name: The Manor Hotel Amsterdam - Hampshire Eden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a bit hesitant to stay here, after reading some of the reviews about the staff behavior, but we had no problems whatsoever. The staff is friendly, helpful, and accommodating. A short walk from the Muiderpoort Train Station, the Manor Hampshire Eden is located along a busy street and close to the tram, restaurants, and shops. It's also conveniently located near Oosterpark.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our check in experience was excellent. The friendly woman at the front desk welcomed us and spoke English very well, as does most of the staff here. She was helpful with recommendations on which trams to take into central Amsterdam, and cautioned us about the crowds on Queen's Day and associated disruptions to tram services due to re-routing and increased demand. Our room was located on the street side, a bit of a concern due to traffic noise, but the windows were extremely well insulated, and you could barely hear the outside noise. Our view was somewhat hampered by the awnings over the windows.
reviews.title: Amazing Place, Shocking Staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was comfortable. A large screen TV played mostly Dutch programming, but BBC, and SkyNews were available. The bathroom was modern and very clean. Some other reviewers noted the frosted glass door and the clear glass panels along either side of the bathroom mirror, allowing for peeping into the bathroom. This was not a major concern for us, but for strangers or more modest people sharing the room, it could be uncomfortable. The shower has no curtain, just a partial panel, so you have to be somewhat careful so as not to splash too much water around. There were plenty of shelves to keep toiletries and towels. An in-room safe in the closet came in handy for storing valuables. It was large enough to accommodate a small laptop computer.
reviews.title: Overall a Very Nice Experience

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet in the dining room was nice. Nothing fancy. There was bacon, scrambled and boiled eggs, sausage, smoked salmon, cheeses, cold cuts, coffee, espresso, juices, and a variety of pastries and croissants. If you're looking for a quick bite to eat before heading out to explore, the buffet might be a good option for you. If you're in no hurry, there are several cafes up the street that are available too.
reviews.title: I expected more from a 4* hotel

reviews.text: Overall, the Manor Hampshire Eden is a good value, conveniently located to local transportation, shops, and restaurants, and is a well-managed property, The rooms are clean, the restaurant and bar are nice, and the staff is accommodating and friendly. It's a bit far from Central Amsterdam, but the neighborhood it's in is nice. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely consider this hotel for a future stay,
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel but Far from City Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was perfect for my first visit to Amsterdam. I booked the hotel online and we got a fantastic deal for a 3 night stay with Booking.com. We travelled from the airport by public transport - train to Central Station and the number 9 tram to Liennaustraat when we were thankfully prompted by the tram driver that this was the stop for the Manor Hotel. Only a 2/3 minute walk to the front door, couldn't have been more perfect. The check in itself was easy the receptionist was very polite. I overheard the couple next to us being asked to specify if they would like a double bed, which they chose. We had booked a double bed so I didn't mention anything, however when we got to our room we had 2 twin beds pushed together. I rang down straight away but was advised I could only get a double bed if I upgraded as the category of room we booked they had no more double beds available. I did mention that I specifically booked a double bed and although the receptionist was sorry she could not accommodate us they were sold out of double beds. This was bad practice in my eyes overselling what you do not have to get the business in, but it was our first day away and I wasn't going to let this get to me. Over the course of the 3 days we used the hotel as our base for getting out and about and seeing the sites of Amsterdam. The hotel although is outside the centre is a great spot to navigate around the City. The Van Gogh Museum and Heineken Experience are only a few minutes tram ride away from the space and equally Dam Square is very accessible. We mainly dined and went out in Leidlesplein which had some great bars and restaurants and again only a few minutes tram ride away. Our Breakfast was not included and we didn't dine in the hotel as a result as we were mainly gone from the hotel each day, that said I had a quick peek at the menu and it looked nice. The hotel was a great choice for us, a good base and a friendly team. The hotel is not open too long and its still looks great - and I would definitely recommend it!
reviews.title: Easily Accessible, Modern Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very pleasant contemporary hotel which, in my opinion, is worthy of it's 4 star rating.A bit of a late check in time of 3pm although they are very happy to store your baggage whilst you grab a bite to eat or sightsee if you are early.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money,10 minutes from central Amsterdam by tram

reviews.text: Rooms are modern in design and spacious.Plenty of room to hang and store clothes etc.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel would go back again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was comfortable and welcoming after pounding the tourist trail and had plenty of pillows.The LCD tv had a few English speaking channels including BBC 1 and Sky News and some Dutch channels too.
reviews.title: Honeymoon at Manor Hotel Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shower room and toilet may not be to everybodys taste due to the modern frosted glass door and window.If you're a bit shy then this might be a romance killer! However the shower room is equipped with a nice large shower area,a hairdryer and some lovely smelling Ritual toiletries (which you can buy in the town centre).
reviews.title: I have no doubt, I will repeat / Sin duda alguna repetiría

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel by car, was great to have parking at the front door of the hotel.
reviews.title: Easter Stay

reviews.text: Our check in was pleasant with no queue.
reviews.title: Nice and pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was on the 2nd floor, only comment I had was lift went to 2nd floor but our room was actually down a flight of stairs. It appeared that as this was an old building it had almost a mid floor with no direct access to the lift. Could be difficult for the less able to cope with large suitcases.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was overlooking the back of the hotel with a garden view, not overlooked. The facilities were of a high standard, good bathroom with shower.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For us the bed was disappointing it was 2 singles pushed together and the bedding made up separately, as the floor has no carpet the beds slipped apart. Also the beds are very,very soft which is not our preference.
reviews.title: Noisy, no privacy and extremely rude staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a week. Good hotel, easy to get around using the trams, good location if you want a quieter area to go back to sleep in. The staff were friendly and helpful. Crazy wallpaper in the corridor, not great if you have had a few, but that's Amsterdam for you.The bed was comfy and clean. Had a good time.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK it's not city centre but that's what makes this hotel perfect for a break in the city as its only 10 minutes away from the hustle and bustle by tram in this quiet suburb. The breakfasts are great, the evening meals are fantastic and the staff very attentive and helpful.
reviews.title: Well worth it.

reviews.text: The rooms are well appointed and very clean. The room we had was very spacious with very high ceilings, great lighting and quality flat screen tv.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Would love to go again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well worth a visit and if the chance arises we will be back.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, very enjoyable holiday in Amsterdam

description: Certified with the Golden Green Key.
